title: Portrait, 1854
medium: Technique: Jacquard woven; plain weave (white) patterned by warp and weft floats variously bound, and continuous supplementary wefts (yellow and rust-red) variously bound on the front, which on the back outside the picture are bound as 3&1 twill
creditline: Gift of the Estate of Herman A. Elsberg
description: Woven portrait of Philippe de la Salle (1723-1803) after a portrait by De Boissieu (1736-1810) and woven by Louis Reybaud.

tombstone.epitaph:
Portrait, 1854.
1854. Technique: Jacquard woven; plain weave (white) patterned by warp and weft floats variously bound, and continuous supplementary wefts (yellow and rust-red) variously bound on the front, which on the back outside the picture are bound as 3&1 twill. Gift of the Estate of Herman A. Elsberg. 1939-1-1.
